geninfo.para: This TSI applies to all models with tandem axles and a power divider.
Navistar vehicles are equipped with two types of PDL control systems:

item.para: Reverse Lockout is spring engaged/air disengaged and is used on all Spicer tandem axles except the Spicer S400 Model. The control valve used in this reverse lockout application is P/N 2015934C1, which has a quick connect air fitting.

Standard Lockout is air engaged/spring disengaged and is used on all Rockwell and Eaton tandems and the Spicer S400 Model. The control valve used in this standard lockout application is P/N 2014371C1, which also has a quick connect air fitting.

note.para: The latest release of the above PDL control systems went into production August, 1996 at Chatham and October, 1996 at Springfield.

geninfo.para: Prior to this change, all tandem axle manufacturers could have used either PDL control system. To determine which type PDL control system is used, compare the PDL cover design and location of the air input port to the examples shown in Chart 1.
